medical_history.chief_complaint: Sudden onset of thoracic pain related to deep in- and exhalation.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a 71-year-old male, experienced sudden onset of thoracic pain after 11 months of being stable post-ICD implantation. The symptoms progressed over a week of unsuccessful ibuprofen treatment for suspected pleuritis and possible muscular-skeletal pain, leading to hospital presentation. Initial symptoms included altered electrical characteristics of the lead observed two months prior, followed by non-specific thoracic pain, and eventually severe symptoms after 1300 ml of haemorrhage accumulated in the pericardial sack.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Coronary artery disease, impaired left ventricular ejection fraction of 24%, persistent atrial fibrillation.
medical_history.social_history: Physically active, cycling and playing golf; taking warfarin.
